contest-event.event-date: Nov. 1, 1947 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Freedom (Brass Band Symphony No. 1) Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Frank Wright was appointed referee. Prizes: 1st: 200 Guineas 2nd: 150 Guineas 3rd: 75 Guineas 4th: 50 Guineas The awards were made at the evening Festival Concert. The contest started at 12.00 noon. The programme cost 6d and all proceeds went to the Printers Pension Almhouse and Orphan Asylum. We have received anonymous feedback stating that there were three celebrity "guest conductors" at this event (Henry Wood, Adrian Boult and Malcolm Sargent), but not stating what they conducted. If you have more details, please let us know.
